Aloevera.description: Aloe vera is a succulent plant species of the genus Aloe.
Aloevera.uses: It is used in skin treatments, and the gel is popular for burns and cuts.

Amla.description: Amla, also known as Indian gooseberry, is a fruit-bearing tree.
Amla.uses: It is rich in vitamin C and is used in traditional medicine.

Amruta Balli.description: Amruta Balli is a medicinal vine known for its rejuvenating properties.
Amruta Balli.uses: It is used to boost immunity and treat digestive disorders.

Arali.description: Arali is a flowering shrub often used in landscaping.
Arali.uses: Traditionally, its leaves and flowers are used in folk medicine.

Ashoka.description: Ashoka is a sacred and medicinal tree in India.
Ashoka.uses: Its bark is used in treating gynecological disorders and inflammation.

Ashwagandha.description: Ashwagandha is a potent adaptogen used in Ayurvedic medicine.
Ashwagandha.uses: It helps reduce stress, improve sleep, and boost cognitive function.

Avocado.description: Avocado is a nutrient-dense fruit known for its healthy fats.
Avocado.uses: It supports heart health and is commonly used in skincare products.

Bamboo.description: Bamboo is a fast-growing plant used for its versatile applications.
Bamboo.uses: Its shoots are edible, and the plant is used in construction and crafting.

Basale.description: Basale is a leafy green vegetable popular in South Indian cuisine.
Basale.uses: It is rich in vitamins and used to treat respiratory issues.

Betel.description: Betel is a heart-shaped leaf commonly chewed with areca nut.
Betel.uses: It has digestive and breath-freshening properties.

Betel Nut.description: Betel Nut, or Areca Nut, is the seed of the areca palm.
Betel Nut.uses: It is chewed for its stimulant properties, though excessive use can have health risks.

Brahmi.description: Brahmi is a herb used to enhance memory and cognitive function.
Brahmi.uses: It is often used in Ayurvedic medicine for brain health and mental clarity.

Castor.description: Castor is a plant that produces seeds used to make castor oil.
Castor.uses: Castor oil is used as a laxative and for skin care.

Curry Leaf.description: Curry Leaf is an aromatic leaf used extensively in Indian cooking.
Curry Leaf.uses: It is believed to improve digestion and lower cholesterol.

Doddapatre.description: Doddapatre, also known as Indian borage, is an aromatic herb.
Doddapatre.uses: It is used in the treatment of coughs, colds, and respiratory issues.

Ekka.description: Ekka is a plant traditionally used in folk medicine.
Ekka.uses: It is used to treat wounds, fever, and digestive problems.

Ganike.description: Ganike is a medicinal plant known for its anti-inflammatory properties.
Ganike.uses: It is used in the treatment of arthritis and joint pain.

Guava.description: Guava is a tropical fruit known for its high vitamin C content.
Guava.uses: It is used to boost immunity and improve digestion.

Geranium.description: Geranium is a fragrant plant with medicinal and ornamental uses.
Geranium.uses: It is used in aromatherapy and skincare for its soothing effects.

Henna.description: Henna is a flowering plant used to dye skin, hair, and textiles.
Henna.uses: It has cooling properties and is used in traditional body art.

Hibiscus.description: Hibiscus is a flowering plant often used in herbal teas.
Hibiscus.uses: It is known for its antioxidant properties and support for heart health.

Honge.description: Honge, also known as Indian Beech, is a tree with medicinal oil-producing seeds.
Honge.uses: Its oil is used for skin disorders and in traditional lamp oils.

Insulin.description: Insulin plant is known for its ability to regulate blood sugar levels.
Insulin.uses: It is used in treating diabetes and related metabolic disorders.

Jasmine.description: Jasmine is a fragrant flowering plant often used in perfumes.
Jasmine.uses: Its flowers are used in teas and for treating stress and insomnia.

Lemon.description: Lemon is a citrus fruit rich in vitamin C.
Lemon.uses: It is used to boost immunity, aid digestion, and brighten skin.

Lemon Grass.description: Lemon Grass is an aromatic herb used in culinary and medicinal applications.
Lemon Grass.uses: It is used to relieve stress, improve digestion, and fight infections.

Mango.description: Mango is a tropical fruit loved for its sweet taste.
Mango.uses: It is rich in vitamins and is used to improve digestion and skin health.

Mint.description: Mint is a refreshing herb used in cooking and traditional medicine.
Mint.uses: It aids digestion, relieves headaches, and is used in breath fresheners.

Nagadali.description: Nagadali is a medicinal herb used in Ayurvedic treatments.
Nagadali.uses: It is used to treat respiratory issues and improve lung function.

Neem.description: Neem is a tree known for its medicinal properties.
Neem.uses: It is used in skin care, oral hygiene, and as an insect repellent.

Nithyapushpa.description: Nithyapushpa is a flowering plant known for its vibrant blooms.
Nithyapushpa.uses: It is used in traditional medicine to treat skin and digestive issues.

Nooni.description: Nooni, or Noni, is a tropical plant known for its antioxidant properties.
Nooni.uses: It is used to boost immunity and improve skin health.

Papaya.description: Papaya is a tropical fruit known for its digestive benefits.
Papaya.uses: It is rich in enzymes and is used to treat indigestion and inflammation.

Pepper.description: Pepper is a spicy fruit used in cooking and traditional medicine.
Pepper.uses: It aids digestion and has anti-inflammatory properties.

Pomegranate.description: Pomegranate is a fruit known for its antioxidant properties.
Pomegranate.uses: It is used to improve heart health and boost immunity.

Raktachandini.description: Raktachandini is a medicinal plant with anti-inflammatory properties.
Raktachandini.uses: It is used to treat wounds, ulcers, and skin disorders.

Rose.description: Rose is a flowering plant known for its beauty and fragrance.
Rose.uses: Its petals are used in skincare and aromatherapy.

Sapota.description: Sapota, also known as Chikoo, is a tropical fruit with a sweet taste.
Sapota.uses: It is used to boost energy, improve digestion, and support bone health.

Tulasi.description: Tulasi, or Holy Basil, is a sacred plant in India with medicinal properties.
Tulasi.uses: It is used to treat respiratory disorders and enhance immunity.

Wood Sorel.description: Wood Sorel is a small herb known for its sour taste.
Wood Sorel.uses: It is used to treat fevers and improve digestion.
